meanings.definition: Required or expected to be paid
meanings.sent1: The bill was payable by the end of the month.
meanings.sent2: The rent is payable on the first of each month.
meanings.sent3: It's always a good idea to have payable bills organized.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was running thin, like a soon-to-be payable debt.
meanings.sent5: The teacher made the importance of homework payable with a reward system.

meanings.sent1: The invoice is payable upon receipt.
meanings.sent2: The loan is payable in monthly installments.
meanings.sent3: He found the idea of a payable debt amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a debt that was always payable in smiles.
meanings.sent5: The happiness from helping others is a priceless but payable reward.

meanings.definition: A sum of money that is owed or due
meanings.sent1: The company had many payables to settle.
meanings.sent2: The accountant kept track of all the payables and receivables.
meanings.sent3: The stack of payables on his desk seemed to grow taller each day.
meanings.sent4: The payables loomed over him like dark clouds on a stormy day.
meanings.sent5: She diligently worked through the list of payables, ensuring everything was in order.
